traits.label: name
traits.name: :name
traits.desc: Used to specify the name of the control; Useful if dealing with forms submitted directly to a URL

traits.label: landscape
traits.name: :landscape
traits.desc: Display the component in landscape mode

traits.label: mask
traits.name: :mask
traits.desc: Mask (formatting string) used for parsing and formatting value

traits.label: locale
traits.name: :locale
traits.desc: Locale formatting options

traits.label: calendar
traits.name: :calendar
traits.desc: Specify calendar type

traits.label: color
traits.name: :color
traits.desc: Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

traits.label: text-color
traits.name: :text-color
traits.desc: Overrides text color (if needed); Color name from the Quasar Color Palette

traits.label: dark
traits.name: :dark
traits.desc: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

traits.label: square
traits.name: :square
traits.desc: Removes border-radius so borders are squared

traits.label: flat
traits.name: :flat
traits.desc: Applies a 'flat' design (no default shadow)

traits.label: bordered
traits.name: :bordered
traits.desc: Applies a default border to the component

traits.label: readonly
traits.name: :readonly
traits.desc: Put component in readonly mode

traits.label: disable
traits.name: :disable
traits.desc: Put component in disabled mode

traits.label: model-value
traits.name: :model-value
traits.desc: Date(s) of the component; Must be Array if using 'multiple' prop; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:model-value' event) OR use v-model directive
examples: v-model="[myDate1, { from: myDateFrom, to: myDateTo }, myDate2]"

traits.label: title
traits.name: :title
traits.desc: When specified, it overrides the default header title; Makes sense when not in 'minimal' mode

traits.label: subtitle
traits.name: :subtitle
traits.desc: When specified, it overrides the default header subtitle; Makes sense when not in 'minimal' mode

traits.label: default-year-month
traits.name: :default-year-month
traits.desc: The default year and month to display (in YYYY/MM format) when model is unfilled (undefined or null); Please ensure it is within the navigation min/max year-month (if using them)

traits.label: default-view
traits.name: :default-view
traits.desc: The view which will be displayed by default

traits.label: years-in-month-view
traits.name: :years-in-month-view
traits.desc: Show the years selector in months view

traits.label: events
traits.name: :events
traits.desc: A list of events to highlight on the calendar; If using a function, it receives the date as a String and must return a Boolean (matches or not); If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

traits.label: event-color
traits.name: :event-color
traits.desc: Color name (from the Quasar Color Palette); If using a function, it receives the date as a String and must return a String (color for the received date); If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

traits.label: options
traits.name: :options
traits.desc: Optionally configure the days that are selectable; If using a function, it receives the date as a String and must return a Boolean (is date acceptable or not); If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline; Incompatible with 'range' prop

traits.label: navigation-min-year-month
traits.name: :navigation-min-year-month
traits.desc: Lock user from navigating below a specific year+month (in YYYY/MM format); This prop is not used to correct the model; You might want to also use 'default-year-month' prop

traits.label: navigation-max-year-month
traits.name: :navigation-max-year-month
traits.desc: Lock user from navigating above a specific year+month (in YYYY/MM format); This prop is not used to correct the model; You might want to also use 'default-year-month' prop

traits.label: no-unset
traits.name: :no-unset
traits.desc: Remove ability to unselect a date; It does not apply to selecting a range over already selected dates

traits.label: first-day-of-week
traits.name: :first-day-of-week
traits.desc: Sets the day of the week that is considered the first day (0 - Sunday, 1 - Monday, ...); This day will show in the left-most column of the calendar

traits.label: today-btn
traits.name: :today-btn
traits.desc: Display a button that selects the current day

traits.label: minimal
traits.name: :minimal
traits.desc: Donâ€™t display the header

traits.label: multiple
traits.name: :multiple
traits.desc: Allow multiple selection; Model must be Array

traits.label: range
traits.name: :range
traits.desc: Allow range selection; Partial compatibility with 'options' prop: selected ranges might also include 'unselectable' days

traits.label: emit-immediately
traits.name: :emit-immediately
traits.desc: Emit model when user browses month and year too; ONLY for single selection (non-multiple, non-range)
